subject_terms_3: Photography Great Britain. Royal Air Force.
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a man and a woman, posing beside a sign board for the Royal Air Force Combat Training School. The man is wearing a military uniform and beret, while the woman is dressed in a white shirt and skirt. Behind them, there is a roofed building structure. The photograph is quite faded, with black spots all over.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver and man with Royal Air Force sign
subject_terms_2: Photographs Portraits, Group Soldiers Military education
